result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory L Bowie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA and follow through and anger management and domestic abuse counseling. Must obtain and maintain full time employment. No contact - directly or indirectly - with the victim. Defendant must submit a DNA specimen, as required by law, and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

timeConds.notes:
Must serve 15 days. Huber is granted for employment. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Absolute sobriety is required. 15 days are stayed.

AMENDED 12/08/2014 - HUBER IS REVOKED BY THE COURT

Must serve 15 days. Huber is granted for employment. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Absolute sobriety is required. 15 days are stayed.

AMENDED 12/08/2014 - HUBER IS REVOKED BY THE COURT.

Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Gregory L Bowie in court with attorney Carolyn H Delery.  Robert S Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee. Offer has been made.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Gregory L Bowie in court with attorney Ahmed Jenkins.  Defendant Gregory L Bowie in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
